text: this is a recipe for my friend Luciano
with whom I've traveled in Italy in
Hawaii with occasionally in New York
who's turned me onto a bunch of great
Italian food and one day we were eating
he said well you know about pasta
fagioli a Kotsay Kotsay being mussels
pasta fagioli pasta and beans which
everybody does know about the pasta
beans and mussels that's a different
story so I got details from him I played
around with it I'm gonna share it with
you now
the proportions he said are 25% beans so
about a cup 25% pasta about half a pound
and 50% mussels 2 or 3 pounds we have to
cook the mussels first so that we can
take them out of their shells and we
also want to save their liquid so I'm
cooking them with no liquid at all
because I want as much intense muscle
liquid flavor as I can get in this dish
so cover them come back five minutes
later they'll be open the mussels are
open and we have gorgeous Oh perfectly
aromatic beautiful liquid in the bottom
there so I'm gonna let that cool meal
I'm gonna cook the pasta I'll be back in
about 6 or 8 minutes you join me as I
finish shucking the mussels this is the
mussel broth get some garlic going you
want to undercook the pasta a little bit
because obviously it's gonna sit around
for a minute or two and we're gonna
finish cooking it in here okay garlic
and oil you want that really quite
strong so we're not gonna cook it much
chili flakes Oh smell is already
fabulous come on come on come on beans a
little bit of wine just a splash
the pasta the mussels and now you can
strain this liquid there's gonna be some
sand on the bottom here but if you just
pour it carefully and leave the last
tablespoon or so in there when you see
the sand starting to come to the top
stop pouring and now you're basically
just making sure everything is hot it's
really different from normal pasta
fazool because you've got this
incredible brine enos this real ocean
flavor in here then of course the
texture of the mussels in this is like
your original surf and turf it's great
